title: [K-12] Instructional Design Practice for Mathematics Microlearning: Building Authentic Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of fundamental mathematical concepts and basic mobile device usage proficiency
context.additional_context: A instructional design experience where students engage with real-world math problem-solving scenarios, aiming to develop mobile-accessible microlearning modules

learning_goals: Learners can design three or more microlearning scenarios for solving math problems that reflect real-world contexts
Learners can analyze external materials (graphs, data visualizations, etc.) and apply findings to improve instructional design
Learners can iteratively revise math instructional design drafts two or more times based on peer feedback
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
